title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was a mix of online interviews and in person interviews with different people who are working at the practice in it. It was done very early in the morning or late in the evening.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Help Desk Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and straight to the point kind of deal. In the process currently so I have not completely wrapped up yet and will have to update as we get the final step complete.
Interview Questions: A user is having trouble connecting to the network printer, how would you resolve that problem?

title: HR Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health
Interview Descriptions: Not a terribly difficult interview but not the easiest interview either. They asked some typical interview questions but also some behavioral questions.  Hiring decisions made quickly but job not everything it was portrayed to be.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a mistake you made and how you handled it.

title: Home Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with situation questions.  It was at the main campus.  Nothing too hard, interviewers we’re friendly.  Two staff take turns asking questions.  It was about fourth five minutes long and you could ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this job?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Alpena, MI) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I am out of town so they accommodated and did a zoom call, I was on the call with two administrators. fairly friendly and did not ask super ridiculous questions. Was a fairly basic interview in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Strengths Weaknesses experience why you want the job

title: Cardiac Rehab Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a panel of 4 people. Very informative and professional. A list of 10 questions that were pretty average interview questions followed by a tour of the facility. It was very easy to get along with them.
Interview Questions: What are two strengths and two weaknesses

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, only stuck to basics. Ask questions related to MidMichigan health, and your overall knowledge of the medical field, specific to your chosen area. (Mine was the ER). But overall, nothing bad at all especially since it is a volunteer position
Interview Questions: What do you know about MidMichiagn Health?

title: Certified Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health
Interview Descriptions: in person interview with coordinator and HR, more of a formality since our contract was just switching and the school already wanted to keep me in place., drug and background check

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI)
Interview Descriptions: They did it round table style. You would meet with a few people at one table they would ask,you questions. Then you would go to the next table and it repeated itself. I am a very social person and found it easy. They were kind and courteous. I asked lots of questions and they answered them all.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate?

title: Medical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Bay City, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
It was not organized .The coordinator arrived late . Building under construction .
Unable to determine name on the building .Contract was general but offered as if this was offer which it was not

title: Home Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Alpena, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. Interview was very professional. Made me feel right at home. Helped with anything and everything if they could. Definitely a place i would recommend for others to work.
Interview Questions: why would you want to work here?

title: IT Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview included senior members of the analyst team. Questions were standard with a few zingers included to make one think. Overall, a great interview which had a conversational tone to it.
Interview Questions: If you were a tree, what kind of tree would you be?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and comfortable. A panel of three people posed questions and scenarios and i had to answer them. i was then offered to bring some of my own questions up.
Interview Questions: If you have an irate or upset patient/customer in front of you, how would handle this?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Efficient, Friendly, and pretty standard. There was nothing noteworthy about the interview process. They seemed to hit all the standard questions "Where will you be in 5 years?" " Why MidMichigan" ect. You will interview with you manager and possibly the pharmacy director  depending on your role and the associated schedules.

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Alpena, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was pretty simple; however, it was quite lengthy. From the time I applied to the time I was offered the position took at least 3 months. For the position I was applying, they needed to create a new job posting for (union) and with all the hoops to jump through and processes to be approved, it took much longer than it felt like it should.
Interview Questions: What do you feel you can offer personally and/or professionally to the workplace?

title: Academic Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MyMichigan Health (Midland, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone after the workforce development manager received my resume.  She called and spoke to me regarding my educational background, what topics/areas on interest I had, and how soon I was available to start.
Interview Questions: What was your Master of Public Health concentration? What kinds of projects would you like to work on? Is there a specific area within the hospital where you'd prefer to work? When can you start your internship?
